issue.message: All com.android.support libraries must use the exact same version specification (mixing versions can lead to runtime crashes). Found versions 25.2.0, 25.1.1, 25.0.1. Examples include `com.android.support:animated-vector-drawable:25.2.0` and `com.android.support:design:25.1.1`
Do not treat position as fixed; only use immediately and call `holder.getAdapterPosition()` to look it up later
Do not treat position as fixed; only use immediately and call `holder.getAdapterPosition()` to look it up later
Do not treat position as fixed; only use immediately and call `holder.getAdapterPosition()` to look it up later

By convention, the custom view (`ColorPanelView`) and the declare-styleable (`colorpickerview__ColorPickerView`) should have the same name (various editor features rely on this convention)
By convention, the custom view (`ColorPickerView`) and the declare-styleable (`colorpickerview__ColorPickerView`) should have the same name (various editor features rely on this convention)

Avoid using "`px`" as units; use "`dp`" instead
Must be one of: PixelFormat.UNKNOWN, PixelFormat.TRANSLUCENT, PixelFormat.TRANSPARENT, PixelFormat.OPAQUE

On SDK version 23 and up, your app data will be automatically backed up, and restored on app install. Your GCM regid will not work across restores, so you must ensure that it is excluded from the back-up set. Use the attribute `android:fullBackupContent` to specify an `@xml` resource which configures which files to backup. More info: https://developer.android.com/training/backup/autosyncapi.html

Do not place Android context classes in static fields (static reference to `AdsUtils` which has field `context` pointing to `Context`); this is a memory leak (and also breaks Instant Run)
Do not place Android context classes in static fields (static reference to `BoardEditor` which has field `context` pointing to `Context`); this is a memory leak (and also breaks Instant Run)
Do not place Android context classes in static fields; this is a memory leak (and also breaks Instant Run)
Do not place Android context classes in static fields (static reference to `Realm` which has field `applicationContext` pointing to `Context`); this is a memory leak (and also breaks Instant Run)
Do not place Android context classes in static fields (static reference to `ToolBarController` which has field `toolbar` pointing to `Toolbar`); this is a memory leak (and also breaks Instant Run)
